Based on the user's preferences, I would recommend "The Great Gatsby" as a reference movie. The film is based on F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel of the same name. The story follows Nick Carraway (Keanu Reeves), a young man who moves to West Egg, Long Island, in order to pursue his dreams of wealth and status. The neighborhood is inhabited by a variety of wealthy socialites, including Daisy Buchanan (Scarlett Johansson), Tom Buchanan (Tom Hardy), George Westmore (Ryan Gosling)), and a number of poorer working-class residents, including Nick's cousin, David Carraway (Chris Ellis)), and his friend, John "Dolphin" Fitzgerald (Joseph Sikora)).
At the end of the film, Nick is no longer successful in his dreams of wealth and status. Instead, he has become a poor working-class resident, just like his friends, David Carraway and John "Dolphin" Fitzgerald. In the final scene of the film, Nick is seen sitting alone on a beach, surrounded by the ocean and sand. He looks out at the water, and seems to be lost in thought, reflecting on his past dreams of wealth and status, and now living as a poor working-class resident, just like his friends David Carraway and John "Dolphin" Fitzgerald.
